section.title: connector-notification-facebook
section.para: This connector enables OpenEngSB to post messages as an update message on facebook. It currently uses the Facebook-Java-API for communication with the Facebook API.
Due to the fact Facebook allows messages to contain a maximum of 420 characters, it is possible that a message is getting truncated. When a message is too long a warning is given out.

section.title: Setup
section.para: To make the facebook-connector work, these two steps have to be done,

First you must provide username and password for authentication of the facebook account, and you have to provide the API key and the API secret from the facebook app, which should be communicated with. Therefore set all four constructor arguments of the facebookConnectorImp class.
section.programlisting: <bean id="facebookConnector" class="org.openengsb.facebook.common.FacebookConnectorImpl"> <constructor-arg index="0" value="USERNAME"/> <constructor-arg index="1" value="PASSWORD"/> <constructor-arg index="2" value="API_KEY"/> <constructor-arg index="3" value="API_SECRET"/> </bean>
section.para: The second thing is, you have to manualy grand extended permission to the facebook app
